We seek a highly motivated and collaborative research scientist to develop, manage and help faculty leverage complex environmental research datasets that underpin multiple ?living laboratory? research and educational assets at Appalachian State University and beyond.Through individual work and support of a broad range of faculty research programs, the RIEEE Environmental Data Scientist will enable growth and sustained momentum of basic and applied sustainability research in strategic areas of strength across the university. The following topical areas of focus will help determine the research work relationships that are most critical to the position, based on the faculty and staff working in these areas.Inquiry areas include, but are not limited to:Water resources in changing environments - water quality/quantity monitoring, nutrient loading, restoration assessment, watershed, and groundwater modeling.Meteorology and climate science in mountain environments - aerosol, precipitation and trace gas analysis, meteorological data.Nutrient flow tracing through environmental compartments throughout the High Country region, beginning with phosphorus mapping and mass balancing.Built and controlled environment - building controls automation, energy conservation, indoor air quality, controlled-environment agriculture, precision irrigation, and greenhouse lighting.Clean energy, utility operations, and carbon emissions - greenhouse gas (GHG) inventories, photovoltaic (PV) system optimization, load management, distributed energy resources, global carbon time series.The person in this position will support these and other areas of inquiry in a multidisciplinary environment, by providing key data science expertise. This position will also serve as a shared resource to build and maintain data science competency in researchers and student research assistants. Responsibilities will include:Contribute to multiple projects involving the design, implementation, and integration of datasets and data processing workflows.Submit proposals for research funding, in collaboration with others and independently.Support project teams in generating and adhering to data management plans.Collaborate on the acquisition, processing, validation, quality control, and exploratory analysis of multiple complex datasets.Support broad and secure access to data and data products, when appropriate, via online data repositories, real-time visualizations, the development of new access tools, and/or contributions to external data repositories.Manage disparate, ?messy? datasets characterized by uncertainty and varying degrees of established standardization.Write, test and document high-quality code using various languages and toolsContribute to the production of research products, including data products, visualizations, research publications, training modules, and conference presentations.Liaise with Appalachian?s Information Technology Services? (ITS) systems and others as appropriate to represent research interests in infrastructure development and ensure data are secure and competently managed per University, sponsor, and other relevant guidelines.Serve as the point of contact for international and national environmental data providers and users, where appropriate.

Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is building the next big thing in AI search, and the next big thing is answers.

With the explosion of information and data online, search has never been more important. However, while the world of consumer search has innovated over time, enterprise search has not. In fact, the majority of enterprise search is powered by outdated keyword technology that only scans for keywords and delivers a list of hyperlinks rather than actually answering questions. Yext, the AI Search Company, offers a modern, AI-powered Answers Platform that understands natural language so that when people ask questions about a business online they get direct answers – not links.

We have a big, audacious mission to transform the enterprise with AI search. To achieve that, we need bright minds and diverse perspectives to join our growing company and help us continue to disrupt an industry. Does this sound like you?

We seek a highly motivated and collaborative research scientist to develop, manage and help faculty leverage complex environmental research datasets that underpin multiple ?living laboratory? research and educational assets at Appalachian State University and beyond.Through individual work and support of a broad range of faculty research programs, the RIEEE Environmental Data Scientist will enable growth and sustained momentum of basic and applied sustainability research in strategic areas of strength across the university. The following topical areas of focus will help determine the research work relationships that are most critical to the position, based on the faculty and staff working in these areas.Inquiry areas include, but are not limited to:Water resources in changing environments - water quality/quantity monitoring, nutrient loading, restoration assessment, watershed, and groundwater modeling.Meteorology and climate science in mountain environments - aerosol, precipitation and trace gas analysis, meteorological data.Nutrient flow tracing through environmental compartments throughout the High Country region, beginning with phosphorus mapping and mass balancing.Built and controlled environment - building controls automation, energy conservation, indoor air quality, controlled-environment agriculture, precision irrigation, and greenhouse lighting.Clean energy, utility operations, and carbon emissions - greenhouse gas (GHG) inventories, photovoltaic (PV) system optimization, load management, distributed energy resources, global carbon time series.The person in this position will support these and other areas of inquiry in a multidisciplinary environment, by providing key data science expertise. This position will also serve as a shared resource to build and maintain data science competency in researchers and student research assistants. Responsibilities will include:Contribute to multiple projects involving the design, implementation, and integration of datasets and data processing workflows.Submit proposals for research funding, in collaboration with others and independently.Support project teams in generating and adhering to data management plans.Collaborate on the acquisition, processing, validation, quality control, and exploratory analysis of multiple complex datasets.Support broad and secure access to data and data products, when appropriate, via online data repositories, real-time visualizations, the development of new access tools, and/or contributions to external data repositories.Manage disparate, ?messy? datasets characterized by uncertainty and varying degrees of established standardization.Write, test and document high-quality code using various languages and toolsContribute to the production of research products, including data products, visualizations, research publications, training modules, and conference presentations.Liaise with Appalachian?s Information Technology Services? (ITS) systems and others as appropriate to represent research interests in infrastructure development and ensure data are secure and competently managed per University, sponsor, and other relevant guidelines.Serve as the point of contact for international and national environmental data providers and users, where appropriate.

Overview
Since 2001, the cost of DNA sequencing has dropped more than 100,000-fold, from $100,000,000 USD per human genome to less than $600 USD today. This is resulting in explosive growth of genomics data, which we are combining with machine learning for data-driven agriculture, cancer treatment, reproductive health, and other life-changing applications.

About Us

You will collaborate closely with AI researchers as part of the global AI lab team in the US, UK, and Singapore.

The Petcare Segment consists of five Divisions: Pet Nutrition, Royal Canin, Mars Veterinary Health N. America, Mars Veterinary Health International & Diagnostics, Kinship. Under this new organization of Petcare Product and Service brands, we launched our Strategy in 2018 with an objective to “Create a Better World for Pets by extending global leadership in Nutrition, Health and Services powered by Data”.
With the breadth and scale of our Petcare businesses we have unique and unrivalled data assets. The potential to create benefits for Pets and sustainable competitive advantage is huge and we need to seize this opportunity now.
Our data assets consist of Veterinary data including appointment and invoice details as well as the medical histories and diagnostic details this provides. We have breed and disease marker data from our DNA diagnostics business (Wisdom Health), Location and Activity Tracking data from our Whistle business. From our nutrition businesses we have sales data, some consumer data as well as valuable information about retailers, Veterinarians, Breeders and Shelters. We also have third party data providing us with product purchasing insights and the potential to develop deeper and broader views into Petcare shopping through collaboration and D2C engagement.

We seek a highly motivated and collaborative research scientist to develop, manage and help faculty leverage complex environmental research datasets that underpin multiple ?living laboratory? research and educational assets at Appalachian State University and beyond.Through individual work and support of a broad range of faculty research programs, the RIEEE Environmental Data Scientist will enable growth and sustained momentum of basic and applied sustainability research in strategic areas of strength across the university. The following topical areas of focus will help determine the research work relationships that are most critical to the position, based on the faculty and staff working in these areas.Inquiry areas include, but are not limited to:Water resources in changing environments - water quality/quantity monitoring, nutrient loading, restoration assessment, watershed, and groundwater modeling.Meteorology and climate science in mountain environments - aerosol, precipitation and trace gas analysis, meteorological data.Nutrient flow tracing through environmental compartments throughout the High Country region, beginning with phosphorus mapping and mass balancing.Built and controlled environment - building controls automation, energy conservation, indoor air quality, controlled-environment agriculture, precision irrigation, and greenhouse lighting.Clean energy, utility operations, and carbon emissions - greenhouse gas (GHG) inventories, photovoltaic (PV) system optimization, load management, distributed energy resources, global carbon time series.The person in this position will support these and other areas of inquiry in a multidisciplinary environment, by providing key data science expertise. This position will also serve as a shared resource to build and maintain data science competency in researchers and student research assistants. Responsibilities will include:Contribute to multiple projects involving the design, implementation, and integration of datasets and data processing workflows.Submit proposals for research funding, in collaboration with others and independently.Support project teams in generating and adhering to data management plans.Collaborate on the acquisition, processing, validation, quality control, and exploratory analysis of multiple complex datasets.Support broad and secure access to data and data products, when appropriate, via online data repositories, real-time visualizations, the development of new access tools, and/or contributions to external data repositories.Manage disparate, ?messy? datasets characterized by uncertainty and varying degrees of established standardization.Write, test and document high-quality code using various languages and toolsContribute to the production of research products, including data products, visualizations, research publications, training modules, and conference presentations.Liaise with Appalachian?s Information Technology Services? (ITS) systems and others as appropriate to represent research interests in infrastructure development and ensure data are secure and competently managed per University, sponsor, and other relevant guidelines.Serve as the point of contact for international and national environmental data providers and users, where appropriate.

We seek a highly motivated and collaborative research scientist to develop, manage and help faculty leverage complex environmental research datasets that underpin multiple ?living laboratory? research and educational assets at Appalachian State University and beyond.Through individual work and support of a broad range of faculty research programs, the RIEEE Environmental Data Scientist will enable growth and sustained momentum of basic and applied sustainability research in strategic areas of strength across the university. The following topical areas of focus will help determine the research work relationships that are most critical to the position, based on the faculty and staff working in these areas.Inquiry areas include, but are not limited to:Water resources in changing environments - water quality/quantity monitoring, nutrient loading, restoration assessment, watershed, and groundwater modeling.Meteorology and climate science in mountain environments - aerosol, precipitation and trace gas analysis, meteorological data.Nutrient flow tracing through environmental compartments throughout the High Country region, beginning with phosphorus mapping and mass balancing.Built and controlled environment - building controls automation, energy conservation, indoor air quality, controlled-environment agriculture, precision irrigation, and greenhouse lighting.Clean energy, utility operations, and carbon emissions - greenhouse gas (GHG) inventories, photovoltaic (PV) system optimization, load management, distributed energy resources, global carbon time series.The person in this position will support these and other areas of inquiry in a multidisciplinary environment, by providing key data science expertise. This position will also serve as a shared resource to build and maintain data science competency in researchers and student research assistants. Responsibilities will include:Contribute to multiple projects involving the design, implementation, and integration of datasets and data processing workflows.Submit proposals for research funding, in collaboration with others and independently.Support project teams in generating and adhering to data management plans.Collaborate on the acquisition, processing, validation, quality control, and exploratory analysis of multiple complex datasets.Support broad and secure access to data and data products, when appropriate, via online data repositories, real-time visualizations, the development of new access tools, and/or contributions to external data repositories.Manage disparate, ?messy? datasets characterized by uncertainty and varying degrees of established standardization.Write, test and document high-quality code using various languages and toolsContribute to the production of research products, including data products, visualizations, research publications, training modules, and conference presentations.Liaise with Appalachian?s Information Technology Services? (ITS) systems and others as appropriate to represent research interests in infrastructure development and ensure data are secure and competently managed per University, sponsor, and other relevant guidelines.Serve as the point of contact for international and national environmental data providers and users, where appropriate.

Overview
Since 2001, the cost of DNA sequencing has dropped more than 100,000-fold, from $100,000,000 USD per human genome to less than $600 USD today. You will collaborate closely with AI researchers as part of the global AI lab team in the US, UK, and Singapore.

At Illumina, you can expect a highly competitive salary accompanied by a market-leading benefits package. You will be part of the global leader in the DNA sequencing industry, where you will find robust growth opportunities and career development.

The Petcare Segment consists of five Divisions: Pet Nutrition, Royal Canin, Mars Veterinary Health N. America, Mars Veterinary Health International & Diagnostics, Kinship. Under this new organization of Petcare Product and Service brands, we launched our Strategy in 2018 with an objective to “Create a Better World for Pets by extending global leadership in Nutrition, Health and Services powered by Data”.
With the breadth and scale of our Petcare businesses we have unique and unrivalled data assets. The potential to create benefits for Pets and sustainable competitive advantage is huge and we need to seize this opportunity now.
Our data assets consist of Veterinary data including appointment and invoice details as well as the medical histories and diagnostic details this provides. We have breed and disease marker data from our DNA diagnostics business (Wisdom Health), Location and Activity Tracking data from our Whistle business. From our nutrition businesses we have sales data, some consumer data as well as valuable information about retailers, Veterinarians, Breeders and Shelters. We also have third party data providing us with product purchasing insights and the potential to develop deeper and broader views into Petcare shopping through collaboration and D2C engagement.

These nudges help people build better habits, work smarter and connect with their colleagues.

Over time, our nudges grow increasingly aware of the timing, messaging, and motivational techniques that inspire individual employees towards action.

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

We are seeking a talented Data Scientist to join our customer success team. Data scientists play a key role, providing analytical support and expertise to both our internal teams and customers. We seek a highly motivated and collaborative research scientist to develop, manage and help faculty leverage complex environmental research datasets that underpin multiple ?living laboratory? research and educational assets at Appalachian State University and beyond.Through individual work and support of a broad range of faculty research programs, the RIEEE Environmental Data Scientist will enable growth and sustained momentum of basic and applied sustainability research in strategic areas of strength across the university. The following topical areas of focus will help determine the research work relationships that are most critical to the position, based on the faculty and staff working in these areas.Inquiry areas include, but are not limited to:Water resources in changing environments - water quality/quantity monitoring, nutrient loading, restoration assessment, watershed, and groundwater modeling.Meteorology and climate science in mountain environments - aerosol, precipitation and trace gas analysis, meteorological data.Nutrient flow tracing through environmental compartments throughout the High Country region, beginning with phosphorus mapping and mass balancing.Built and controlled environment - building controls automation, energy conservation, indoor air quality, controlled-environment agriculture, precision irrigation, and greenhouse lighting.Clean energy, utility operations, and carbon emissions - greenhouse gas (GHG) inventories, photovoltaic (PV) system optimization, load management, distributed energy resources, global carbon time series.The person in this position will support these and other areas of inquiry in a multidisciplinary environment, by providing key data science expertise. This position will also serve as a shared resource to build and maintain data science competency in researchers and student research assistants. Responsibilities will include:Contribute to multiple projects involving the design, implementation, and integration of datasets and data processing workflows.Submit proposals for research funding, in collaboration with others and independently.Support project teams in generating and adhering to data management plans.Collaborate on the acquisition, processing, validation, quality control, and exploratory analysis of multiple complex datasets.Support broad and secure access to data and data products, when appropriate, via online data repositories, real-time visualizations, the development of new access tools, and/or contributions to external data repositories.Manage disparate, ?messy? datasets characterized by uncertainty and varying degrees of established standardization.Write, test and document high-quality code using various languages and toolsContribute to the production of research products, including data products, visualizations, research publications, training modules, and conference presentations.Liaise with Appalachian?s Information Technology Services? (ITS) systems and others as appropriate to represent research interests in infrastructure development and ensure data are secure and competently managed per University, sponsor, and other relevant guidelines.Serve as the point of contact for international and national environmental data providers and users, where appropriate.

About Us

We support a diverse set of customers including executive leaders, product managers and data staff. We are an interdisciplinary team with experts in data science, statistics, and economics.

Who we are
We're Humu — we build products based in behavioral science that help people grow and thrive at work. In short, we're here to make work better.
Humu nudges people towards better ways of working, unlocking the potential of individuals, teams, and organizations. We enable companies to drive positive change by deploying personalized, scientifically-backed suggestions called nudges to employees. These nudges help people build better habits, work smarter and connect with their colleagues.
What you'll get to work on
Humu's Nudge Engine® deploys thousands of customized nudges—small, personal steps—throughout organizations to empower every employee, manager, team, and leader as a change agent. Over time, our nudges grow increasingly aware of the timing, messaging, and motivational techniques that inspire individual employees towards action.

Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is building the next big thing in AI search, and the next big thing is answers.

With the explosion of information and data online, search has never been more important. However, while the world of consumer search has innovated over time, enterprise search has not. In fact, the majority of enterprise search is powered by outdated keyword technology that only scans for keywords and delivers a list of hyperlinks rather than actually answering questions. Yext, the AI Search Company, offers a modern, AI-powered Answers Platform that understands natural language so that when people ask questions about a business online they get direct answers – not links.

We have a big, audacious mission to transform the enterprise with AI search. To achieve that, we need bright minds and diverse perspectives to join our growing company and help us continue to disrupt an industry. Does this sound like you?

Overview
Since 2001, the cost of DNA sequencing has dropped more than 100,000-fold, from $100,000,000 USD per human genome to less than $600 USD today. This is resulting in explosive growth of genomics data, which we are combining with machine learning for data-driven agriculture, cancer treatment, reproductive health, and other life-changing applications.

You will collaborate closely with AI researchers as part of the global AI lab team in the US, UK, and Singapore.

Who we are
We're Humu — we build products based in behavioral science that help people grow and thrive at work. In short, we're here to make work better.
Humu nudges people towards better ways of working, unlocking the potential of individuals, teams, and organizations. We enable companies to drive positive change by deploying personalized, scientifically-backed suggestions called nudges to employees. These nudges help people build better habits, work smarter and connect with their colleagues.
What you'll get to work on
Humu's Nudge Engine® deploys thousands of customized nudges—small, personal steps—throughout organizations to empower every employee, manager, team, and leader as a change agent. Over time, our nudges grow increasingly aware of the timing, messaging, and motivational techniques that inspire individual employees towards action.

Job Title: Data Scientist - Role can be remote
Job Description:
The Petcare Segment consists of five Divisions: Pet Nutrition, Royal Canin, Mars Veterinary Health N. America, Mars Veterinary Health International & Diagnostics, Kinship. Under this new organization of Petcare Product and Service brands, we launched our Strategy in 2018 with an objective to “Create a Better World for Pets by extending global leadership in Nutrition, Health and Services powered by Data”.
With the breadth and scale of our Petcare businesses we have unique and unrivalled data assets. The potential to create benefits for Pets and sustainable competitive advantage is huge and we need to seize this opportunity now.
Our data assets consist of Veterinary data including appointment and invoice details as well as the medical histories and diagnostic details this provides. We have breed and disease marker data from our DNA diagnostics business (Wisdom Health), Location and Activity Tracking data from our Whistle business. From our nutrition businesses we have sales data, some consumer data as well as valuable information about retailers, Veterinarians, Breeders and Shelters. We also have third party data providing us with product purchasing insights and the potential to develop deeper and broader views into Petcare shopping through collaboration and D2C engagement.

Job Summary:
The University of Wisconsin Biotechnology Center (UWBC) and the Center for Genomic Science Innovation (CGSI) are committed to maximizing the benefits of biotechnology research within the University of Wisconsin-Madison, University of Wisconsin System, State of Wisconsin, and the nation. The Centers facilitate high quality, comprehensive, multidisciplinary research and supports, coordinates, disseminates, and advances biotechnology.

The UWBC is a large and complex organization containing 13 sub-units and the CGSI, and administers the Computation and Informatics in Biology and Medicine (CIBM) graduate training program and the Genomic Sciences Training Program (GSTP). The Center has a variety of funding sources; federal and non-federal grants and awards, and seven fee-for-service revenue generated 136 accounts.

UWBC is a synergistic blend of core service facilities, research, and outreach activities. The Bioinformatics Resource Center (BRC), one of UWBC core facilities, is seeking to add a highly self-motivated individual to our team. This individual will be responsible for working with research personnel to implement bioinformatics and statistical methods for a myriad of project types. This will involve scripting, exploration of parameter selections, summarizing large data in tabular and graphical formats, and providing detailed documentation of all methods used. This individual will work closely with a collaborative group to develop robust workflows that can be efficiently applied to similar projects. Many aspects of these analyses are computationally intensive requiring high-throughout infrastructure available at the BRC.

Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence play a critical role in transforming CCB Operations. The ability to utilize data in meaningful ways allows us to develop solutions which both our customers and employees can benefit from. Customers expect tailored servicing and Chase is looking to deliver personalization to meet their needs. This is powered by high-quality annotated data and detailed annotation schemes that are the backbone of impactful AI/ML algorithms and applications.

As a Product Delivery - Data Annotator, you will work closely with and partner with teams in Data Science, Analytics and Engineering on the collection, curation, annotation, enrichment and validation of data and the development of taxonomies and other linguistic resources to help train machine learning models, drive insight, analysis, and possible content creation.

About Carvana
If you like disrupting the norm and are looking for a company revolutionizing an industry then you will LOVE what Carvana has done for the car buying experience. Buying a car the old fashioned way sucks and we are working hard to make it NOT suck. At Carvana, our customers can hop online to...

Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.

Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.
About the Role
The Central Science team focuses on understanding the long-term and causal impact of actions taken by viewers, creators and Twitch. We discover insights and build prediction and causal inference tools to make these knowledge more accessible for teams across Twitch. We support a diverse set of customers including executive leaders, product managers and data staff. We are an interdisciplinary team with experts in data science, statistics, and economics.

We are seeking a talented Data Scientist to join our customer success team. Data scientists play a key role, providing analytical support and expertise to both our internal teams and customers. At DataChat we are building a groundbreaking analytics platform that users interact with using precise natural language to perform a full stack of data science functions. The role provides an opportunity to establish and grow your career in the highly desired field of data science.

As a junior data scientist you will be responsible for working with a wide range of stakeholders to complete data science workflows to solve real world problems. This will include working with pre-sales, customer success, and customers to define data science problems and solve them using the DataChat platform.

The role requires a technical background with an emphasis on data science skills including, data querying and cleaning, data visualization, machine learning, and python scripting via jupyter notebook. Having prior experience in customer facing roles is a plus. The ideal candidate will have a passion for solving data problems to make a real world impact.

Job Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist who will help us discover the information advantage hidden in vast amounts of data, and help us make smarter decisions to deliver better products and services. Your primary focus will be in applying data science techniques, including machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrating with our products and services. This role will work with other data scientists in the team on data science projects to enhance revenue and mitigate risk.

Job Title: Graduate Data Scientist - Role Can be Remote
Job Description:
The Petcare Segment consists of five Divisions: Pet Nutrition, Royal Canin, Mars Veterinary Health N. America, Mars Veterinary Health International & Diagnostics, Kinship. Under this new organization of Petcare Product and Service brands, we launched our Strategy in 2018 with an objective to “Create a Better World for Pets by extending global leadership in Nutrition, Health and Services powered by Data”.
With the breadth and scale of our Petcare businesses we have unique and unrivalled data assets. The potential to create benefits for Pets and sustainable competitive advantage is huge and we need to seize this opportunity now.
Our data assets consist of Veterinary data including appointment and invoice details as well as the medical histories and diagnostic details this provides. We have breed and disease marker data from our DNA diagnostics business (Wisdom Health), Location and Activity Tracking data from our Whistle business. From our nutrition businesses we have sales data, some consumer data as well as valuable information about retailers, Veterinarians, Breeders and Shelters. We also have third party data providing us with product purchasing insights and the potential to develop deeper and broader views into Petcare shopping through collaboration and D2C engagement.

Join our mission-driven organization, where your work matters and a diversity of ideas and backgrounds are welcomed. AbleTo is the leading provider of high quality, technology-enabled behavioral health care. We believe that everyone deserves access to high-quality care and offer a suite of technology-enabled services to empower people to lead better lives through better mental health. A proprietary platform connects individuals with AbleTo highly trained licensed providers who deliver weekly sessions by phone or video supported by an integrated digital experience. Members also have access to mental health coaches, and digital support programs. Our outcomes-focused approach is proven to improve both behavioral and physical health and lower medical costs.

Job Description:
It takes a Blizzard to make a Blizzard game, and that level of effort doesn’t end once the game is released; we support our games for years after they’re in the hands of gamers world-wide. Global Insights works closely with the game development, business and internal service teams at Blizzard to produce insights and models that enable us to make the most epic player experiences. The machine learning & AI (Artificial Intelligence) group within Global Insights focuses on applying the latest in key research areas to build lasting data products and tools for our game and business teams.

Who we are
We're Humu — we build products based in behavioral science that help people grow and thrive at work. In short, we're here to make work better.
Humu nudges people towards better ways of working, unlocking the potential of individuals, teams, and organizations. We enable companies to drive positive change by deploying personalized, scientifically-backed suggestions called nudges to employees. These nudges help people build better habits, work smarter and connect with their colleagues.
What you'll get to work on
Humu's Nudge Engine® deploys thousands of customized nudges—small, personal steps—throughout organizations to empower every employee, manager, team, and leader as a change agent. Over time, our nudges grow increasingly aware of the timing, messaging, and motivational techniques that inspire individual employees towards action.

Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is building the next big thing in AI search, and the next big thing is answers.

With the explosion of information and data online, search has never been more important. However, while the world of consumer search has innovated over time, enterprise search has not. In fact, the majority of enterprise search is powered by outdated keyword technology that only scans for keywords and delivers a list of hyperlinks rather than actually answering questions. Yext, the AI Search Company, offers a modern, AI-powered Answers Platform that understands natural language so that when people ask questions about a business online they get direct answers – not links.

We have a big, audacious mission to transform the enterprise with AI search. To achieve that, we need bright minds and diverse perspectives to join our growing company and help us continue to disrupt an industry. Does this sound like you?

At MarketDial we equip our clients with the easiest-to-use and most accurate solution to conduct offline A/B testing. In short, we provide our clients with the tools they need to set up statistically robust trials to test various initiatives across their business. This allows them to learn quickly and have greater confidence in the initiatives they ultimately decide to roll out - saving time, money, and energy. To date, our software has allowed our clients across the retail, grocery, c-store, restaurant, and manufacturing markets to make sophisticated multi-million dollar marketing, pricing, staffing, and operational decisions through offline A/B testing.
We pride ourselves on offering our clients unparalleled support to ensure their success with MarketDial. We are currently seeking a Data Scientist to uniquely support our clients in the U.S. and abroad.
